alert.note: Alert for Cascades in Lane County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 21 at 3:13PM PST until December 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...MORE SNOW ON THE WAY FOR THE CASCADES TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY... .Another storm system will take aim at the Cascades of Oregon and southwest Washington beginning overnight tonight and persisting through most of Wednesday. Heavy snow is expected at elevations above 3000 to 4000 feet. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM WEDNESDAY TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations between 14 and 24 inches. * WHERE...Cascades in Lane County. * WHEN...From 8 AM Wednesday to 4 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel conditions are expected to be difficult. Expect snow and ice covered roads and greatly reduced visibility.
info.instruction: Be prepared for winter driving conditions with snow and ice covered roads and very limited visibility. If you must travel in the mountains, slow down, and allow plenty of extra time to reach your destination. Allow extra following distance to the vehicle in front of you, and keep snow chains and a winter survival kit, including a flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
